title: Tanzania calls for private investment to boost Ngorongoro tourism
desc: Tanzania has urged the Ngorongoro Conservation Area Authority to deepen private sector engagement to expand accommodation, transport and tourism products as visitor numbers rise.

title: New federal grocery rebate will cost $12.4 billion, PBO estimates
desc: The parliamentary budget officer announced Monday that the Canada Groceries and Essentials Benefit will cost an estimated $12.4 billion.

title: I jumped from 13ft window to stop torment of OCD… I was paralysed but it’s not stopped me from having amazing sex life
desc: ON the surface, Anya Darlow seemed like a typical teenager, navigating the same pressures as most people her age - school, dating, and the trials...

title: "High-pitched scream' on night Noah Donohoe disappeared
desc: A woman has told the Noah Donohoe inquest that she heard a "high-pitched scream" on the night the schoolboy disappeared.

title: Mercedes blasts rivals over F1 engine loophole claims
desc: Mercedes Formula One boss Toto Wolff blasted rivals for casting doubt on the legality of his team's new engine through secret meetings and letters.

title: A smiling Cher laughs at her Grammys flubs in a good-natured, chaotic appearance
desc: Cher may have wanted to turn back time on her rather chaotic Grammys presenting experience

title: Frank Cushnahan found not guilty in Belfast NAMA trial
desc: A Co Down businessman has been found not guilty of fraud connected to the sale of NAMA's Northern Ireland loan book.

title: Presidency defends journalist Beukes' removal from State House
desc: %%title%% %%sep%% %%primary_category%% %%sep%% %%sitename%% %%sep%% The Presidency has defended the removal of journalist Jemima Beukes from State House on Monday, citing protocol violations, while a media union has condemned the incident as state-sponsored intimidation.

title: Nvidia: The Story Behind the Most Watched Company on Earth
desc: The chip giant's path to success is worth knowing.

title: Battling Waterford go top with win in Kerry
desc: Bríd McMaugh struck 1-04 as Waterford made it two wins on the bounce after a deserved four-point win against reigning champions Kerry in this second round Lidl Ladies Division 1 encounter at Fitzgerald Stadium.
